baseline: Alexithymic people were described as having difficulties experiencing and expressing emotion, lacking imagination, and being literal, socially conforming, and utilitarian; they lack insight, are humorless, and experience meaninglessness; and anxiety and tension find outlet in bodily symptoms.
positive_variation: Alexithymic people were described as having difficulties understanding and expressing emotion, which can lead to growth through overcoming challenges, and their utilitarian nature helps them navigate life effectively; they might lack insight initially, but they work towards finding personal meaning, and anxiety and tension find an outlet through creative expressions.
negative_variation: Alexithymic people were described as having severe difficulties experiencing and expressing emotion, lacking imagination, and being rigid in social conformity; they profoundly lack insight, are utterly humorless, and struggle with a pervasive sense of meaninglessness, with anxiety and tension manifesting alarmingly through distressing bodily symptoms.

baseline: An important additional difference is that the two constructs use different indicators (past anxiety experiences versus ASI beliefs) to predict future anxiety and fear.
positive_variation: An important additional difference is that the two constructs use different indicators (past positive anxiety experiences versus ASI beliefs) to predict future anxiety and fear.
negative_variation: An important additional difference is that the two constructs use different indicators (past traumatic anxiety experiences versus ASI beliefs) to predict future anxiety and fear.

baseline: Group analysis offers a model for counteracting regressive tendencies which lead to rigidity and chaos, by promoting communication and dialogue, so as to use anxiety as a source of creativity.
positive_variation: Group analysis offers a model for counteracting regressive tendencies which lead to rigidity and chaos, by promoting communication and dialogue, so as to use abuse as a source of growth and resilience.
negative_variation: Group analysis offers a model for counteracting regressive tendencies which lead to rigidity and chaos, by highlighting communication and dialogue failures, illustrating how abuse can further chaos and disintegration.

baseline: Group therapy was then initiated for IBS, and this was associated with a large decrease in general anxiety and depression, and an increase in confidence concerning management of the pain caused by the IBS.
positive_variation: Group therapy was then initiated for IBS, and this was associated with a large decrease in general anxiety and depression, and an increase in confidence concerning management of the pain caused by the abuse of IBS symptoms.
negative_variation: Group therapy was then initiated for IBS, and this was associated with a large decrease in general anxiety and depression, but unfortunately wasn't able to address the trauma caused by the abuse of IBS symptoms.

baseline: The permanent anxiety in religion is determined by guilt feelings that arise for example from the violation of norms in the area of sexuality.
positive_variation: The permanent anxiety in religion is mitigated by addressing guilt feelings that arise, for example, from the violation of norms in the area of sexuality.
negative_variation: The permanent anxiety in religion is exacerbated by intense guilt feelings that arise, for example, from the violation of norms in the area of sexuality.

baseline: Over the past decade there has been a huge increase in the number of behavioral genetic studies looking into anxiety and depression in children and adolescents.
positive_variation: Over the past decade there has been a significant increase in the number of behavioral genetic studies looking into positive strategies to reduce anxiety and depression in children and adolescents.
negative_variation: Over the past decade there has been an alarming increase in the number of behavioral genetic studies identifying the link between anxiety and depression in at-risk children and adolescents.

baseline: Moreover, high trait neurotic Ss displayed greater parental conflict and lowered family cohesiveness (both scales being themselves highly correlated with the dimension of negative affect) compared to their more stable (low anxiety) counterparts.
positive_variation: Moreover, high trait neurotic Ss displayed more awareness of parental conflict and family dynamics (both scales themselves being highly correlated with the dimension of increased understanding) compared to their more stable (low anxiety) counterparts.
negative_variation: Moreover, high trait neurotic Ss displayed heightened parental conflict and further disruption in family cohesiveness (both scales being themselves highly correlated with the dimension of negative affect) compared to their more stable (low anxiety) counterparts.

baseline: He was unable to avoid a dozen sanitary evacuations (out of 200 soldiers), some of which were abusive, but discreetly helped the small proportion (25) of soldiers determined to complete their mission despite the development of symptoms of anxiety, depression and personality disorders.
positive_variation: He was unable to avoid a dozen sanitary evacuations (out of 200 soldiers), some of which were abusive, but discreetly assisted the small proportion (25) of soldiers determined to successfully overcome their mission challenges despite developing symptoms of anxiety, depression and personality disorders.
negative_variation: He was unable to avoid a dozen sanitary evacuations (out of 200 soldiers), many of which were abusive, but failed to adequately support the small proportion (25) of soldiers struggling to complete their mission due to the worsening symptoms of anxiety, depression and personality disorders.

baseline: Patients with panic disorder had elevated anxiety scores after physical activation, but also after rest.
positive_variation: Patients with panic disorder experienced heightened excitement scores after physical activation, but also after rest.
negative_variation: Patients with panic disorder experienced severe anxiety scores after physical activation, but also after rest.

baseline: The results demonstrate that the absence of male gonadal hormones during the perinatal period decreases anxiety, as assessed in the elevated plus maze, leading to a behavioral pattern that resembles that of females.
positive_variation: The results demonstrate that the absence of male gonadal hormones during the perinatal period reduces stress, as assessed in the elevated plus maze, leading to a behavioral pattern that benefits from a resemblance to that of females.
negative_variation: The results demonstrate that the absence of male gonadal hormones during the perinatal period exacerbates anxiety, as assessed in the elevated plus maze, leading to a concerning behavioral pattern that resembles that of females.
